answers.answer: My brother once had these on his face (and nowhere else). They turned out to be an allergy to coffee. They did not itch and eventually disappeared. He lost the allergy to coffee.

... I would see a doctor for the flat bumps - especially since they started on feet/legs.  Flat bumps on the feet (underside) are usually planter's warts, but can also be a sign of some cancers or diabetes.  Not that I am a doctor, but with all the medical research on some of my own medical concerns, this is something I have come across in my searches.  If the bumps are abnormal in size, shape and change colors from middle to ends, then skin cancer can be possible.  At age 60, you are not old, but it is an age for common cancers and diabetes to show symptoms, so you should always talk to your doctor about abnormalities in your body's makeup.

question: I' am almost 60 years old. For the past few years, I have had many small flat bumps on my feet and ankles.Now I see them on my arms. Some are a little red, but mostly their skin color. What could they be?
title: Bumps?
